comments.commentBody:
Romney, has could be given credit for having a good grasp of economy, both from the government and business perspective, promised to lower the unemployment rate to 6% by the end of first term. All this with GOP Congress to work with.

Obama did get the unemployment below the 6% by 2014 without any cooperation from Congress. I guess this little nugget is telling the whole story, not only that Obama's economy is best under the circumstances, but also another argument than on average democratic presidents are much better (by a substantial margin) in handling the national economy.

The economy isn't bustling, but it is growing, slowly and steadily. The entire planet is undergoing economic malaise. Growth rates are down all over the planet. The US economy is one of the strongest around. Other major nations are so weak, they have negative interest rates.

Oh but you see, Trump is a wealthy businessman so he knows how to run our economy. Trump is very good at using other people's money, not paying what he owes, using the bankruptcy laws to his advantage, and skirting taxes. Drug lords have lots of money. That doesn't mean they should be president.

Then there is the rehash of trickle down economics. Mr. Trump, why don't you propose that people that make over one million pay no taxes? Then there will be even more money that trickles down into the pockets of working class people. If a little trickling is good, why isn't a flood of trickling better? Do the same for the big corporations. Eliminate taxes on only the SP500 companies. I'm sure none of that money will bypass the workers and go to the shareholders. Don't bother with the small companies. Not enough money there to trickle down.

So Trump, don't hold back. Go all the way. We need more trickling. It's worked so well so far, that it has created millions of struggling, disenfranchised voters who flock to you for more of the same. Tell them that we just need more time and more trickling. The GOP leadership will back you on this one.

On hearing this awful 'joke' today, one of my students asked, "Is this what you meant when you said this is not a normal election season?"  Gods, the unlimited vileness of many Republicans this year has been appalling.
Im impressed so few people here get it like lver . america turned into bunch deplorable who need an want to be told what to beleive in . Closer we get to election more intense the comments wil become
So terrible to host musical evenings, Hamilton cast, ... Better to have isolated despots sitting in their thrones.
The reason nobody likes Obama is he's got too many friends.

It's already begun, but this time it's kind of creepy.

For the last eight years we were constantly being updated on which big name Obama was recently "chilling" with around the White House. Now it seems the next eight will be exactly the same, only worse.
I am a regular person and I support Mrs Clinton.

Trump cares about Trump, he has stiffed workers, carried on affairs while married to Melania , and actually sexually assaulted a news reporter while his pregnant wife Melania was upstairs.  The man makes perverted, sexual innuendos about his own daughter ... Trump only cares about Trump... kapeesh?
Yeah, he only has part of the FBI, the leaky part.

Jesse Marioneaux - Absolutely.  Expect any Republican-controlled chamber to start impeachment proceedings on January 21, probably by stirring up the ashes of the email issue and probably with input from DT.  If we embrace HRC's vision of an equitable country, a nation of shared respect and opportunity, we have to give her a chance to implement.  The Republicans, from Paul Ryan on out, are standing by with shackles at the ready.  A vote for a Democratic Member of Congress is a vote for Hillary Clinton as President-effective and not just as President-elect.

Sec. Clinton has actually laid out *plans* to help those left behind in our economy.

Trump's 'plans' consist of saying he will make it all ok (apparently, we have neither legislative nor judicial branches) and a platform of reducing taxes on the wealthy.

It is not Sec. Clinton's fault that the media - and, it seems, many of the people - prefer gossip to policies.

If you don't want to get the shot, you can find lots of sites that will give you excuses not to. My husband doesn't like shots, but as a middle school teacher he had the flu nearly every year. Since a friend in the health care field convinced him that he should get shots for me--I'm asthmatic and was pretty sick with cancer treatment for a while--he's been flu free.

Best of both worlds--I take vitamin D and get a flu shot too. And I never come down with the flu anymore. My n of one against yours.
Often, you are better with the WaPo and Reuters -- NYC is basically a showtown.
Trump has John Sununu for stand up comedy!

It's not surprising that Hillary Clinton has so many "Big Names" supporting her. She's a sane, bona fide candidate. Nor is it surprising that Donald Trump goes it alone. He has alienated his GOP party members, but also, none of them want to be tainted by his brand. Don"t feel bad for him!

This piece is a nice bit of fluff, but I have searched in vain on the NYTimes site for some report of the forged letter purportedly sent to Mrs. Clinton by Sen. Tom Carper, now being investigated by officials including the FBI. This is a story that was put out by Reuters, after Sen. Carper submitted the fake letter to the authorities. It's ironic the FBI is part of the investigations since there has been other reports about their rogue behavior, including their closeness to Rudy Giulliani. So much intrigue and nastiness out there! WaPo has reported also. I'm interested in the Times' take on this but unable to locate it.
Maybe if the republicans quit trying to suppress the vote of black voters and quit trying to undermine our democracy we could move toward peace.
Save the world by dying of the flu?

Melania Trump worked illegally 10 times in our nation (isn't amazing that Donald Trump says he'll fix everything that he and his family have exploited - build a wall, fix taxes and trade, "the system"?) Can a person be sicker than him?
Like celebrity Trump? The irony here is amazing.

I am doing my part to end this nightmare, including donating, voting and volunteering. You are right, the result affect us all in the world. I was thinking of moving to Germany if Trump wins, but you cannot escape the influence.

Yes, we all owe a great debt to William Safire's utterly unfounded, partisan attack on Hillary Rodham. It seems we also owe a great deal to thoughtless people who parrot the smears of the very  elites who hate the people who parrot them.
It's a shame that all that education has failed to teach you how to discern truth from fiction.

Alan, when I was a very young boy I recited the 23rd Psalms in Church. I got the verse down pat. But when I ended I didn't know what to say. In the Scriptures I should have said AMEN. But I froze and said "The End."  The church laughed. I have been permanently scarred ever since. AMENs don't agree with me.
Any one who votes for either democrat or republican are voting for same people 1 percent. Only canidate is true american is jill stein which gearge washington would be proud of today
You think trump allows checks and balances?
Clinton "forges" with people, as long as those people make substantial contributions to the Clinton Foundation.

This typifies the stark difference between Clinton and Trump. Hillary collaborates with people. Donald forges on with his "I alone" mantra. If he gets in, he's in for a rude awakening regarding such minor things as separation of powers and checks and balances.

Mark

There is a difference between Trump's sexual behavior and Hillary's husbands sexual behavior. Hillary's husband isn't running.

I have been reading your comments for several years and thought you insightful. What happened?
Not only does HRC not need to 'hire' supporters - as DJT did early in his campaign - she also has people who have worked with and for over the years who love her.  Donald has NDAs.
Typically people vote in their neighborhoods in cities, not across town via bus or subway....

Trump has 2 big names campaigning for him:

Jim Comey

Willie Brown, who has conveniently shut down the Philly transit system to suppress the vote.
Mark--the Spanish flu pandemic was nearly 100 years ago, so there were virtually no real drugs to use on it.  Even now treatment for the flu is usually symptomatic at best.

I'm a Bernie supporter and gave quite a bit of money to his campaign but it's long over due to grow up and know our democracy is under attack if Trump wins. Bernie and Elizabeth Warren will be working close with Hillary to help get progressive policies passed. I love Bernie and Elizabeth Warren and respect that they support Hillary Clinton. I had no problem voting for Hillary.

Nick: why not take a break from the contrariness and yammering about how terrible everything is and making the weak tea case for Donald. You live in a beautiful place. The Clinton you keep presenting is a construction of years of GOP whiners making a Burning Woman sculpture of the every bad mom  archetype known to humanity out of her and yet, if you bothered to watch the debates you saw an imminently qualified serious person who does not want to kill you or take your gun and who likes problem solving. Trump is better suited to Vegas and he can take his act there and try to reclaim any shred of believability so his real estate worth can quit plummeting.
